intro: Sasamorpha oshidensis, commonly known as the Oshida's sasamorpha, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features include a slender stem and a distinct, aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
